Journal Story:
After section hiking for several years I have completed from Amicalola to Dalesville. My generous sweet husband has relented and is encouraging me to FINISH. I will start from Dalesville on April 14 and doggedly head to Katahdin. No one has ever accused me of being fast, just determined. My longest section was 300 miles, so I have some idea what to expect. my gear is pretty much sorted out, though I have not decided whether to bring my stove (alcohol) or go cold. I've carried stove and fuel a hundred miles or more without using it more than once, so I'm leaning toward cold.Just bought my first smart phone so that I can check the weather and text home (I had a really really stupid phone). I became Swamptromper because of all the time I spend slogging in South Florida maintaining the Florida Trail. I considered changing that to the caning lady, since my life has brought me new "occupation" to keep me out of the poorhouse during retirement. I restore/repair all kinds of woven seats; sort of like basket weaving. A customer once said it was a hybrid of OCD and Zen. I agree. Hiking is kinda like that too.
"Swamptromper" came from a dear friend who is no longer with us; my respect for him kept me from changing that, so Swamptromper I will remain.

I've decided to use a few maildrops so send meds, personal items, freeze dried veggies, and my cold coffee blend - 1 part chocolate boost powder + 2 parts whole powdered milk + 3 parts instant coffee. The rest will come as it comes along the trail and can't be planned. I'm a "Keep Australia on Your Left " kind of person anyway, so too much planning gives me a headache.

Time is flying. I still have lots of work to finish beforeI leave, and most of my time is being spent on that. I have not even started to pack anything yet, but I think that I have most of what I'll need. Back to work... caning is just a continuous over under over under over under...today it's a porch rocker.

Leaving my husband, JV & grand kids and critters for four months will be a test for me-especially Jaxson,my 65# catahoula/cattle dog mix . He's a big doofus who is a momma's boy. Soft collar didn't work too well for him, he destroyed it in a day!
I'm getting close to prepared... 7 resupply boxes packed and ready to go. Have said good bye to many of my friends. 6 more chairs to finish and I will be all set!
Made it up the hill just shy of the shelter. Many thanks to Homer for the shuttle! Losing my light-good night.
Loving every minute of the day,even though I am nauseous from the Wendy's in Daleville!
Loving every minute of the day,even though I am nauseous from the Wendy's in Daleville! Happy Easter to all!

Might want to rethink the haircut!!!shuttle part way here
Too sick to walk any farther. Thought it was the burger in Daleville 
,but just got worse. Can't eat or drink. Feeling a little better,will resume as soon as I can keep water down. Still happy though,the woods are spectacular!!!
Buds are just coming in on the trees. Will be nice to have some shade. Been high 70's. Still fighting stomach issues but going forward. Love it !

Cold rain all day Love my new gear, I was warm and dry. Sicker than ever,but know it will pass. Working on about 400 calories and less than a litre of water. Tomorrow will improve!! Grateful to be out here.
Very short but beautiful day! Vicki snatched me off the trail for a night in town. Expect a full day tomorrow. Feeling like a million bucks right now!
Koda got to the spring first! Poor baby was hot! Stomach is all better and it's time to start moving. Gorgeous day toady. Started at noon when Vicki headed north. Many many thanks to her!
My first night in a shelter. Was joined by Willdebeast a bit later. Raining and cold today, the shelter was very enticing !
Another day of cold rain 8 of us in a 6 person shelter and 3 more in tents.
Another day of cold rain 8 of us in a 6 person shelter and 3 more in tents.
No photo today. Cold rain all day.....again!

Ahhhhh DRY EVERYTHING!!! Lucky me. I got to 60 and a log truck came up the hill and stopped. I grabbed my stuff and tried to run. Probably a comical sight. I opened the door and the driver laughed... I wasn't going to pick you up... he said, but what the heck,get in. What a nice guy. It was raining and I was soaked! Part of what I love about hiking. Peace.

sorry, but keeping up with trail journals takes too much time. From now on I will only post on Facebook.
